Yuri Gagarin was Russian pilot and astronaut. He was the first human to journey into outer space. He, on his spacecraft Vostok, completed an orbit of the earth on 12 April, 1961. Yuri Gagarin was born in the village of Klushino, Russia on March 9, 1934. His parents worked on a farm. He was the third of four children. In 1946, Gagarin completed his secondary education at Klushino. At the age of 16, in 1950, he entered a foundry steel factory near Moscow. He did his graduation from a vocational school in 1951. Then he took a training as Soviet Air Cadet at a local club where he learned to fly at first. He again graduated from a technical school in 1955 and he was recruited in the Soviet Army. He became a lieutenant in the Soviet Air Force in 1957. In 1960, Yuri was selected for Soviet space programme. On 12 April, 1961 he became the first human to travel into space and move round the earth. He died in 1968 in a plane crash.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: On 12 April, 1961, on the spacecraft Vostok, Russian pilot and astronaut Yuri Gagarin took the first journey into the outer space in the history of mankind. He was born as the third child to his farmer parents on March 9 , 1934. He completed his secondary education in 1946 at Klushino and at the age of 16 , he started working in a foundry steel factory near Moscow. After graduating from a vocational school in 1951, he took training as Soviet Air Cadet at a local club. After getting his second graduation degree in 1955, he joined Soviet army and became a lieutenant in the Soviet Air Force in 1957. As a selected candidate for Soviet space programme, he became the first human to travel into space. He died in a plane crash in 1968.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on 'A Rainy Day' answering the following questions:.
(a) How is a rainy day? (b) What happens in the rainy season? (c) What do people do on this day? How do the animals and birds pass this day? (d) What do the children do on this day? (e) How do you pass the day"?

sub_questions.explanation:
A Rainy Day
A rainy day is dull and gloomy. Sometimes, it drizzles and sometimes, it rains heavily all day long. The sky remains overcast with black clouds. The sun is hardly visible. Gusty wind blows from all sides. Birds keep standing on branches of trees or keep quiet in their nests. Cattle remain in their sheds and bellow for the fodder. Water stands here and there. Unpitched roads become muddy and slippery. Passers-by have to walk with umbrella over their head, shoes in hand and pants folded up to the knee. Sometimes people slip and fall on the muddy road. In cities, a rainy day is now a horror. The roads and streets in some towns and cities get flooded. Vehicles are seen stranding in knee-deep water in some areas due to water clogging. It causes gridlock across the city. It is a day of trouble and annoyance to the office-going people. They have to suffer from yarious inconveniences. But for the school going children, it is a delight to have a rainy day. If it rains heavily before their school time, they get a holiday. Sometimes, children, especially the boys play football in the rainwater in the nearby fields. A rainy day is a curse for the poor. The day labourers cannot go out for work and hence, they have to suffer a lot. However, I pass the day by listening to music, watching TV or reading journals. In short, a rainy day is a day of both pleasure and pain.

Gias Uddin Azam Shah was a great ruler of Bengal. He was very kind and just. He was fond of hunting. One day, he went a hunting at a nearby jungle. He aimed at a fawn but his arrow missed its target and pierced into the chest of a young boy who died

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Sajib and your friend is Tania who is living in Sylhet. Now, write an email to your friend describing about the co-curricular activities of your school.

sub_questions.explanation:
Zindabazar, Sylhet
22 April 2020

Dear Nazim,
My heartiest compliments go to you. Hope, that you are hale and hearty. In your last letter you wanted to know about the co-curricular activities in my school.
You know that I am lucky to study in such a big and famous school which offers us facilities to learn a lot of things besides studies. We can depend on our teachers not only for study matters but also for matters related to our interests. Some of them run different clubs in school. The clubs are places where one can go and pursue his or her hobby. I'm a member of the debating club. We practise debating within the club and arrange debating competitions among different classes and among other schools as well. Our English teacher who runs this club, not only guides us in writing good speeches but also shows us how to present them. 'Our school arranges essay competitions and book reading competitions. Moreover, my school offers a wide range of extra-curricular activities for the students. The school has a musical group and a lot of dramas are played by the students. Besides, the students enjoy hockey and football as extra-curricular activities. Teachers consult with the students at personal level and encourage them to work more and more. The students of this school learn not only for examinations but also for life. In short, I can tell you studying in this school is a great experience. Along with the regular study, we can develop our extracurricular abilities as well.
I guess, you are planning to shift to a new school. If you ask for suggestion from me, I'll recommend my school without any hesitation.

With best wishes
Monir

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Rasin. You have a friend Nobojit. He lives in a village. Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend on the merits and demerits of village life and city life.

sub_questions.explanation:
Ritu : Hello, Situ! Nice to see you here. How are you?
Situ : I'm fine, thanks. What about you?
Ritu : I'm ok. I think it would be better if you got yourself admitted into a college in the city as I did.
Situ : I don't think so, Ritu. Actually, I don't like cities.
Ritu : Why? What're the things of city life you dislike?
Situ : I think, life in the city is very artificial. People lead a very busy life there. They get up in the morning hearing the noises of motor vehicles, machines and factories.
Ritu : You're right. But there are many modern facilities that you can have only in cities. Good educational institutes, hospitals and clinics are mainly available in the city. Again, there are many spots for recreations.
Situ: : That's true. But I think life in the village is far better than that of the town. Village life is quite natural. People lead a very simple life. They wake up from sleep hearing the chirping of the birds and can breathe in fresh air: Do you have fresh fish in the town
Ritu : - Actually, fishes are available there, but not fresh.
Situ : But fresh food, fishes, vegetables, fruits etc. are available in the village, Moreover, village life is pollution free.
Ritu : You're right. But village life is not without its disadvantages. Disease, hunger, malnutrition and poverty are common in the life of the villagers. Also, jobs are not available here.
Situ : Hmm. Actually, both lives have their advantages and disadvantages. I think a balanced development can remove the gap between these two types of life.
Ritu : Yes. I agree with you. See you later.
Situ : Ok, bye. Take a good care of yourself.
